author: Julian Ortiz Serrano
comment: I love this watch face. The customization is amazing, makes you feel like you actually own the app, worth the $1.99 upgrade to the pro. The only issue I have is that the step counter step up is all over the place. First it doesn't show anything, when it reads from Google Fit it doesn't read correctly, and reading from the watches sensors give me exacerbated readings. Other than that is really great! Huawei Watch 2

author: Fry Smith
comment: I love the look of the face and the apparent customization. But I can't get any of the tap actions to work. I've tapped just about everywhere and I've tapped and held down and nothing happens. Idk if tap actions are like a paid feature or something but I'd really like to know.

author: Michael Kean
comment: On moto 360 first edition this appears to break the battery gauge, so at the end of a day you're at 90 percent but the watch turns off around 85 percent. Also weather feature never works.

author: Robin Brandt
comment: The UI and design of this app is great. I recommend this to anyone looking for a highly customizable watch face.

author: Markus Stöhr
comment: Works perfect. Had Problems first because my watch wasn't updated. Great Watchface.

author: Ashley Wilbourne
comment: downloaded free version and couldn't get the face on my Zenwatch 3 with Android Wear.  Do I really have to purchase to have any features not just the *-ed ones?

author: Dennis Sievertz
comment: Like it but the title of calendar events keep showing up in the middle of the time row on my zenwatch 3

author: Sweetu Christie choise
comment: Not work on samsung on7

author: Hunny Bunny
comment: This app is not pairing with my Samsung Gear s2 which is a android watch

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Unfortunately Omega only works on Android Wear watches. It will not work on the Samsung Gear S2, which is a Tizen watch not an Android Wear watch.

author: Diego V
comment: I can turn myself invincible when there is a shooting
On my own personal email address

author: Adam Eckert
comment: Watch face looks great, phone app for settings is unresponsive to all input making it impossible to change face settings

author: Justin Reid
comment: Works very well if you have the paid version.

author: Rob Kelly
comment: I thought this watch face was great and for a short time it worked with no issues. Now it won't update or sync with my phone. If I hadn't paid for the pro version I wouldn't have minded... but I did. May as well get a free watch face that works.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Hey Rob, I'm sorry the app hasn't lived up to your expectations. Unfortunately this is a bug with Android Wear, some possible solutions are to 1) resync apps 2) reboot both devices 3) reinstall the app 4) reinstall the Android Wear app / clear data 5) factory reset the watch. I hope one of those solutions works for you!

author: dale quaid
comment: The app never worked right between  the phone and watch. The phone's battery level would not display (it does on other watch faces I have). The app would not put its self in Android wear, and any thing I tried to change in options did nothing on the watch even after syncing. There is no option to do 12hr format.

author: Glenn Potter
comment: The android wear app won't 'see' the Omega watch face since upgrading to 2.0 - really don't want to have to load it up on the watch, concerned about battery life now

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Can you try the latest update? There is a setting for setting a custom location to use for the weather, which seems to be the cause of the weather failing. Unfortunately I'm not sure about the crashes, there are some new fixes that hopefully fix them. Please let me know if you continue to experience any crashes!

author: Mascha Collier
comment: I like the look of this watchface a lot. 3* is because I can't seem to change the temperature from F to C.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: There is a setting under the "Weather" section to change that, does it not work for you?

author: urmonator
comment: Couldn't sync with watch. I have the most updated Wear app, Moto 360 2nd Gen software is up to date, this app is up to date. I have tried resyncing apps. I've tried disconnecting and reconnecting the watch. I tried reinstalling software and resetting the watch. Nothing. Such a bummer because it was a cool idea.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Please try these potential solutions:

- Make sure you have the latest version of the app (3.1.1)
- Reinstall the app on your watch
- Resync apps from Android Wear application
- Clear data from the Android Wear application
- Unpair your watch from Android Wear, reinstall Android Wear, then re-pair your watch and install the app

author: Robert Hairymonster
comment: I was looking for the black n white faces but they are only ambient mode, doesn't say it though, bought the fully one thinking it's that but not, that's why I gave it 2 stars.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Would you like the option to have the watch be in ambient mode all the time?

author: Brandon Falk
comment: Great watch face. Really hits you with the nostalgia. This app initially didn't show the current battery level of my watch (Fossil Q Marshall), but after I contacted the developer about the problem a patch was released that fixed the problem. Thanks again!

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Thank you for reporting the bug, apologies again for the issue but I greatly appreciate your feedback!

author: Joseph Miceli
comment: Hello my is Joe Miceli and i am contacting you regards to the Goldeneye watch face. I have the paid version for the Galaxy S 5 for at@t. It is lolipop 5.0 and model 900A. I have the app installed on my phone but it won't seem to install on to my Asus Zenwatch 2. I have tried uninsalling the app, paid key and facotory seting the watch. I have also tried re synching apps in Android Wear and refreshing in the Omega Watch app. It does not list the face within the watch when pressing and holding down on the watch to try to change the face. I have had this watch face before on the watch when I used a Moto X, first generation. If you could please contact me at your convenience with any solutions on how to transfer your watch face from my new phone to the watch. Thank you and have a nice day! - Joe

author: Red Wolf Music
comment: Crashed a few times and it prevented watch face switching.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey,

I'm sorry Omega has been causing problems on your watch. Can you please install the latest version (3.0.10) and let me know if there are still crashes? You can try clearing the application data or reinstalling the application if issues persist. If you are still unable to use the watch, please contact me at kevin@broh-kahn.com.

Thanks,
Kevin

author: john burnett
comment: I can't get it on my watch

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey John,

Please try these potential solutions:

- Make sure you have the latest version of the app (3.0.10)
- Reinstall the app on your watch
- Resync apps from Android Wear application
- Clear data from the Android Wear application
- Unpair your watch from Android Wear, reinstall Android Wear, then re-pair your watch and install the app

author: W Arnquist
comment: Great concept - if you played the old N64 game "Goldeneye" you'll appreciate this!  This watch brings back that warm fuzzy feeling and brings back fantasies about cutting through the floor with my watch laser (still wish I could do that... dang!).  Tip - if you're on Android Wear 2.0 and install this watch face on the watch itself, make sure you go back to your phone and install it there as well!  That's the only way that you'll be able to make customizations and ensure all data is synced with the watch.  Great job guys! The only problem I'm having at the moment is that the weather seems to get stuck after a while. When I pressed the refresh button in the app it synced, but not sure for how long. It was showing 59 degrees for a long time during these sunny Orange County days.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: I apologize for the problems you've been experiencing. We are currently working on an improvement to keep the weather up to date. Be sure to check for an update in a few days!

author: Martin Dawson
comment: Download to phone but unable to upload to watch?

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey Martin,

Please try these potential solutions:

- Make sure you have the latest version of the app (3.0.10)
- Reinstall the app on your watch
- Resync apps from Android Wear application
- Clear data from the Android Wear application
- Unpair your watch from Android Wear, reinstall Android Wear, then re-pair your watch and install the app

author: Dave Pellow
comment: I've been using this watchface outside of work since I got hold of a Sony Smartwatch 3 (honestly, it may have been the gimmick that convinced me I wanted one!)  I've just received the update that allows proper support for square watches. Although it's certainly appreciated, now that I've seen it for myself I'd much prefer a toggle that lets me keep the original round face on the watch, as the straight battery indicators spoil the classic look!  Any chance of implementing this option in your next update?

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey Dave,

Thank you very much for your patience. An update will be released later this week, I hope it includes all the functionality you're looking for!

author: Andrew Aleshire
comment: Ive tried to install this, but I cant get the face to appear in android wear or my huawei watch.  I have reinstalled and still no bueno.  Too bad because I love the secret agent face, but would love the functions in this one.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey Andrew,

I'm sorry for the issues! Are you not seeing Omega at all when you try to select a watch face or is the data from your phone (weather/fitness/calendar/battery) not syncing? Either way, can you try reinstalling the app on your phone? Please contact me at kevin@broh-kahn.com if the issue persists.

author: Sokre Haus
comment: Overall great watchface. Been using it for few days, my favorite so far as it shows all useful info on single scree. For my SW3 would only like to see settings for battery bar thiknes as it's using too much realstate. Has some bugs but reinstall, resync solved most....Also would love to see mybe different time zones instead of fitness

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Different time zones is a great idea! Unfortunately varying the battery bar thickness may be difficult, because the bars are currently just an image that doesn't change, and having to draw the bars programmatically based on a thickness setting would be detrimental to battery life, but I will try to think of something.

author: Péter Madai
comment: Needs configuration for selecting calendars.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey Peter,

Unfortunately this is a major feature and may take a while to add. For the time being, would you be able to use the Android Wear app to select which calendars are synced to your watch? Then you can use Omega to only check for events from the watch.

author: Alex Wagner
comment: The only thing that this watch for well was tell you the date. It was laggy, the battery indicator for both watch and phone were incorrect, and it would crash.   Droid Turbo with Moto 360 gen 1

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: I greatly apologize for the issues you've had with the app. Omega was designed to be fast so I'm surprised you're experiencing lag, can you please describe your issues? Also there are known issues with the phone battery level but the watch battery should be 100% accurate. Feel free to email me at kevin@broh-kahn.com

comment: The latest update 1.4.3.01 causes the time, day and date all on the same line and on top of each other, and it's unreadable. Adjusting the font size doesn't help.  So the rating is for the older version.  Edit: After the suggestion by the developer, I uninstalled and reinstalled the app and the problem went away. So if you encounter similar display problems after update, reinstall the app may resolve the issues.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: I'm sorry you're experiencing this issue. Just to clarify, are the time and date misaligned, or the event time, date, and location? If it's the former, could you try changing the vertical positions of the elements?

author: Warren Pass
comment: I like the look and function but keep getting  Screen Overlay d.... Open settings On my Fossil Q founder.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: That's very odd, it could be a function of your watch that the app does not support yet. Can you send me a screenshot at kevin@broh-kahn.com?

author: CARDS Gaming
comment: Adding the additional weather feature is a nice touch. However constantly displays "unable to find location, please contact the developer". There also seems to be a problem with updating the battery icon as resyncing causes the battery icons to be removed and crashes the watchface.

author: Eduardo Perez
comment: This watchface reminds me of goldeneye for the N64

author: flo irimescu
comment: Work perfect on my Sony SW3

author: KK Yau
comment: Force close!!

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Can you please elaborate? Why did you force close? Please contact kevin@broh-kahn.com with more details

author: Peter Bonnis
comment: I liked it until the latest update. It crashes after making changes and sending it to the watch. I have a Huawei

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: I'm sorry for the issues you've been having, it's very unfortunate that Omega does not work for you. Can you try the latest update? Unfortunately I'm not sure about the crashes, there are some new fixes that hopefully fix them. Please let me know if you continue to experience any crashes!

author: Barry Carlson
comment: Just refuses to work with my LG Sport. Won't work at all now, keeps defaulting to a "simple" watch face and I've uninstalled and reinstalled with no luck.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content:
Hey Barry, 

There have been a bunch of errors I don't have the time, patience, or device support to debug, so I released an update that will show a message for some of the major errors. Let me know at Kevin@broh-kahn.com if you see any messages or crashes!

author: Jonathan Yao
comment: Great app, but after the last update, there is a problem with the exact battery numbers.  They do not change positions no matter which battery style you pick.  I also find it annoying that if you uninstall and then reinstall either the phone app or the watch app, the settings reset on the reinstalled app, but doesn't sync up with the other app.  And there is no way to sync them after the reinstall.  I wouldn't mind if both apps reset, but I have to cycle the app setting for every setting I changed to get the watch back to how I had it before.  It's usually faster for me to just reinstall the other app then to cycle though all the settings.

reply.author: Kevin Broh-Kahn
reply.content: Thank you for reporting the issue with the battery positions, that has been fixed with version 1.4.1. I'm a confused regarding the settings reset issue, could you please email me at kevin@broh-kahn.com?

author: Kolme Ray
comment: Oh man. This is a sweet watch face. Well worth the .99 cent upgrade. I had no issues installing or using it. Once upgraded the battery levels are diplaying perfectly. Overall I feel like grabbing the n64 and playing the facility lvl.
